questions.question: What is the primary purpose of creating bee-friendly landscapes?
choices: To support and nurture bee populations
To eliminate the need for commercial pollination
To reduce the use of pesticides in agriculture
questions.answer: To support and nurture bee populations

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a key component of a bee-friendly landscape?
questions.answer: Concrete surfaces

questions.question: What are melliferous plants?
choices: Plants that produce substances collected by bees to make honey
Plants that are resistant to pests
Plants that require bee pollination to reproduce
questions.answer: Plants that produce substances collected by bees to make honey

questions.question: Why is it important to focus on native plant species when creating a bee-friendly landscape?
choices: Native plants are cheaper and easier to maintain
Native plants have co-evolved with local bee populations
Native plants produce more nectar than non-native species
Native plants are resistant to all local pests
questions.answer: Native plants have co-evolved with local bee populations

questions.question: What is the purpose of creating a planting calendar for a bee-friendly landscape?
choices: To ensure a continuous supply of food throughout the year
To coordinate planting with lunar cycles
questions.answer: To ensure a continuous supply of food throughout the year

questions.question: Why do bees need access to water in a bee-friendly landscape?
choices: For drinking and regulating hive temperatures
To attract more bees to the area
questions.answer: For drinking and regulating hive temperatures

questions.question: What is an example of a safe habitat for ground-nesting bees?
questions.answer: Areas of bare soil

questions.question: What is agroforestry?
choices: A method of growing trees for timber production
A land use management system combining trees/shrubs with crops or livestock
A technique for increasing honey production
questions.answer: A land use management system combining trees/shrubs with crops or livestock

questions.question: How does integrating beekeeping with agroforestry benefit coffee production?
choices: It reduces the need for fertilizers
It improves the flavor of coffee beans
It increases coffee yield through improved pollination
It protects coffee plants from pests
questions.answer: It increases coffee yield through improved pollination

questions.question: Which permaculture principle emphasizes the importance of plant diversity in bee-friendly landscapes?
questions.answer: Use and value diversity

questions.question: What is the recommended approach for pest control in bee-friendly landscapes?
questions.answer: Natural pest control methods

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of bee-friendly flowers?
questions.answer: Open shapes for easy access

questions.question: What is the purpose of including dead wood and hollow stems in a bee-friendly landscape?
choices: To provide nesting sites for cavity-nesting bees
questions.answer: To provide nesting sites for cavity-nesting bees

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a benefit of integrating beekeeping with agroforestry systems?
questions.answer: Reduced need for crop rotation

questions.question: What is the primary function of a bee-friendly garden in a community setting?
choices: To produce honey for local consumption
To educate the public about bee conservation
To eliminate the need for commercial beekeeping
To support local bee populations and enhance ecosystem health
questions.answer: To support local bee populations and enhance ecosystem health

questions.question: Which of the following plants is mentioned as a key melliferous plant in Timor-Leste?
questions.answer: Ai-dak (Schleichera oleosa)

questions.question: What is the recommended placement of water sources in a bee-friendly landscape?
choices: In the center of flower beds
Near hives but not too close
As far from the hives as possible
questions.answer: Near hives but not too close

questions.question: Which permaculture principle suggests starting with a small area and expanding gradually?
choices: Use edges and value the marginal
questions.answer: Use small and slow solutions

questions.question: What is the purpose of creating a diverse plant community in a bee-friendly landscape?
choices: To attract a wider variety of pollinators
To reduce the need for fertilizers
To create a more visually appealing garden
To support different bee types and provide year-round forage
questions.answer: To support different bee types and provide year-round forage

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a renewable resource in bee-friendly gardening?
questions.answer: Native plants

questions.question: What role does Ai-kakeu (Casuarina equisetifolia) play in a bee-friendly landscape in Timor-Leste?
choices: Year-round flowering with peaks in dry season
questions.answer: Year-round flowering with peaks in dry season

questions.question: How can climate change potentially affect bee-friendly landscapes in Timor-Leste?
choices: By increasing the number of native bee species
By extending the flowering periods of all plants
By altering the flowering patterns of melliferous plants
By eliminating the need for water sources in gardens
questions.answer: By altering the flowering patterns of melliferous plants

questions.question: What is the significance of including Ai-kafe (Coffea sp.) in a bee-friendly landscape in Timor-Leste?
choices: It provides high nectar production year-round
It is a major cash crop that benefits from improved pollination
It offers the best nesting sites for native bees
It repels harmful insects that prey on bees
questions.answer: It is a major cash crop that benefits from improved pollination

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a recommended practice for creating safe bee habitats?
choices: Providing dead wood and hollow stems
Reducing pesticide use in surrounding areas
Regularly mowing and tidying all garden areas
questions.answer: Regularly mowing and tidying all garden areas

questions.question: What is the primary benefit of using permaculture principles in designing bee-friendly landscapes?
choices: It eliminates the need for human intervention
It creates self-sustaining ecosystems that benefit both bees and humans
It reduces the diversity of plant species required
questions.answer: It creates self-sustaining ecosystems that benefit both bees and humans

questions.question: Which color flowers are most visible to bees?
questions.answer: Blue, purple, and yellow

questions.question: What is the purpose of creating a herb spiral in a bee-friendly garden?
choices: To provide a variety of microclimates for different herbs
To create a visually appealing garden feature
questions.answer: All of the above

questions.question: How does leaving some areas of the garden 'wild' benefit bees?
choices: It allows for the growth of diverse wildflowers
It creates natural corridors for bee movement
questions.answer: All of the above

questions.question: What is the primary challenge in creating bee-friendly landscapes in urban areas?
questions.answer: Lack of space
